div.p: P2416, no. 576, p. 389, unit 11, VPRS 1187/P outward correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

This letter was sent to the Heads of Departments within the Chief Secretary's Department; the original is no. 567 and the other recipients are listed under the annotation: 'Similar to proceeding to …'. 22 March 1867

By desire of the Honble the Treasurer the Chief Secretary directs me to intimate that as it is found to be productive of inconvenience both to the Government and to the persons concerned when any delay takes place in gazetting contracts after they have been duly entered into it is desirable that all contracts should be gazetted as early as possible after execution

You will be good enough also to noted that this is to be done not only whenthe funds have been provided but also when as sometimes occurs it is necessary to make contracts before the votes for the expenditure have passed the Legislature
